pyzui.physicalobject module¶

An object that obeys the laws of physics.

class pyzui.physicalobject.PhysicalObject[source]¶

Bases: object

Constructor :

PhysicalObject()

Parameters :

None

PhysicalObject() –> None

Physicalobject objects are sets of declarations and methods that are used to represent anything that has a 3-dimensional position and velocity, where the z-dimension represents a zoomlevel.

PhysicalObject gets declared on MediaObject and Scene initializations, giving them the necessary attributes, (position, zoomlevel, damp factor zoomlevel, eccetera).

Create a new Physicalpobject at the origin with zero velocity.

damping_factor = 512¶
__damp(velocity, t)¶

Damp the given velocity.

__damp(float, float) -> float

__displacement(t, u)¶

Calculate the displacement at time t given initial velocity u.

__displacement(float, float) -> float

move(dx, dy)[source]¶

Move the pobject by (dx,`dy`).

move(float, float) -> None

zoom(amount)[source]¶

Zoom by the given amount with the centre maintaining its position on the screen.

zoom(float) -> None

aim(v, s, t=None)[source]¶

Calculate the initial velocity such that at time t the relative displacement of the pobject will be s, and increase the velocity represented by v by this amount.

If t is omitted then it will be taken that s is the limit of the displacement as t approaches infinity i.e. the initial velocity will be calculated such that the total displacement will be s once the pobject has stopped moving.

velocity(string, float[, float]) -> None

Precondition: v is either ‘x’, ‘y’, or ‘z’

step(t)[source]¶

Step forward t seconds in time.

step(float) -> None

property moving¶

Boolean value indicating whether the pobject has a non-zero velocity.

__get_zoomlevel()¶

The zoomlevel of the pobject.

__set_zoomlevel(zoomlevel)¶
property zoomlevel¶

TN (take note) this center setter getter definition applies to Scenes objects, MediaObjects have their own centre definition.
